page.title: 08A Schoolgirl's Saturday
page.content: A day in the life of a child on a farm 3.5 miles away from Rhonehouse:- SATURDAY A.M. 7.30 - get up, 7.40 - feed pony and pet lambs, 8.30 - breakfast, 9.00 - go to Castle Douglas for shopping, 12.00 - get home from Castle Douglas and have lunch. P.M. 12.30 - cycle to aunt's with her newspaper and bread, 2.30 - take pony out, 3.00 - go to see granny, 4.30 - walk dogs, 5.00 - feed dogs and cat, 5.30 - tea, 6.00 - watch television, 7.30 - shut in hens, 8.00 - feed the pet lambs, 8.30 - come in and watch t.v., 9.00 - have a bath and wash hair, 9.30 - have supper, a drink and biscuit, 9.45 - go and check pony, 10.15 - go to bed.
